brief.content-text: The animation depicts the difference between a flat network and a hierarchical network topology. The animation begins with an image of a flat network showing three switches directly connected to each other, with five computers directly connected to each switch. The flat network topology represents one large broadcast domain. Next, the topology changes to a hierarchical model with the switched network (Access Layer) connecting to a router at the Distribution Layer. The Distribution Layer router connects to the Core Layer router, which in turn connects to the network cloud. This hierarchical network represents three separate broadcast domains.
